dict.string: Connect to or disconnect from VPN service

# This workflow ships with artwork from Oxygen Icons. # For those icons applies the LGPLv3 licence, see # http://www.oxygen-icons.org/
shopt -s nocasematch;echo "<items>";osascript -e 'set text item delimiters to "\n"' -e 'tell application "System Events"' -e 'tell current location of network preferences' -e 'set vpns to (get name of every service whose (kind is greater than 8)) as string' -e 'end tell' -e 'end tell' | while IFS= read -r line; do if [[ $line == *{query}* ]]; then echo "<item uid=\"\" arg=\"$line\"><title>$line</title>";osascript -e 'tell application "System Events"' -e 'tell current location of network preferences' -e "set VPNservice to service \"$line\"" -e 'set isConnected to connected of current configuration of VPNservice' -e 'if isConnected then' -e 'set result to "<subtitle>Disconnect from VPN Service</subtitle><icon>disconnect.png</icon>"' -e 'else' -e 'set result to "<subtitle>Connect to VPN Service</subtitle><icon>connect.png</icon>"' -e 'end if' -e 'end tell' -e 'end tell'; echo "</item>"; fi; done; echo "</items>"
Connect to or disconnect from VPN service

on alfred_script(q) tell application "System Events" tell current location of network preferences set VPNservice to service q -- name of the VPN service set isConnected to connected of current configuration of VPNservice if isConnected then disconnect VPNservice return "Disonnected from " & q else connect VPNservice return "Connected to " & q end if end tell end tell end alfred_script

This worklflow shows a list of all available VPN services (configured via "System Preferences"->"Network") and allows to connect or disconnect via Alfred.
The workflow ships with artwork from Oxygen Icons. For those icons applies the LGPLv3 licence, see http://www.oxygen-icons.org/
